content: The term "Cold War" refers to the tense political and military rivalry between which two superpowers during the latter half of the 20th century?

The term "Cold War" refers to the tense political and military rivalry between the United States and the Soviet Union during the latter half of the 20th century. This period, spanning from the end of World War II in 1945 to the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, was characterized by mutual distrust, ideological differences, and proxy conflicts around the world, but without direct large-scale military confrontation between the two superpowers.
